The correct answer is A: He says to include the Minecraft version and the mod version in the filename so people can identify it easily.

In the provided excerpt, the narrator says, 'so you're going to need to name your mod file something like this: [Mod Name] - [Minecraft Version] - [Forge Version]. So make sure you include all of that information.' This indicates that including the Minecraft version and the mod version in the filename is essential for proper identification.

The correct answer is A: The Minecraft Launcher Installations view with a list of versioned profiles and a plus icon at the top.

In the tutorial, the narrator explains that after launching the Minecraft Launcher, they will be taken to the Installations view where they can see a list of available versions of Minecraft. At the top of this list, there is a small plus icon that the narrator mentions they will click on. This action will allow them to create a new profile for the version of Minecraft they want to install (in this case, version 1.14.4).
